org.commonreality.time

Interface IAuthoritativeClock

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IClock
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAuthoritativeClock, BasicClock.BasicAuthoritativeClock, NetworkedClock.NetworkedAuthoritativeClock, OwnedClock.OwnedAuthoritativeClock, WrappedClock.WrappedAuthority

    public interface IAuthoritativeClock
extends IClock
    A clock instance that permits the setting of the clock as well. "Setting" is not the correct term, rather "requesting", as the behavior ultimately depends upon the implementation and other interfacing agents. The idea is that a time request is made to set the time to a value (or wait for a change) before the wait futures are returned.
    For instance, the shared clock instance (where multiple clocks move in lock-step based on the smallest time increment requested) uses the requested values to determine the smallest time step.
    The authority clock also has support for local timeshifting, permitting consistent time across different systems.
    Author:
    harrison
